column1: Conditions that may lead to the problem include: - Viral infection - Nodule on the lymph node - Polyp or tumor The reason for the problem is more likely to be found in older children.
Intussusception can affect both children and adults.
The first sign of intussusception is very often sudden, loud crying caused by abdominal pain.
Your doctor will perform a thorough exam, which may reveal a mass in the abdomen.
Antibiotics may be needed to treat any infection.
Intravenous feeding and fluids will be continued until the child has a normal bowel movement.
When a hole or tear in the bowel occurs, it must be treated promptly.
